description.narrative: By 2021, children, families of communities and institutions (schools and FOSA) in the intervention zones, have functional and accessible sanitary facilities.

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, children, families of communities and institutions (schools and FOSA) in the intervention zones, have functional and accessible sanitary facilities.

description.narrative: 228 villages representing 76% of targeted villages, reached the Open Defecation Free status. Among these ODF villages, 228 are pending certifications by the government. The 228 ODF-certified villages cover 135,768 people. Also, 7,672 school children from 17 schools and 300 patients of one health center have access to improved sanitation facilities. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:26/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of village triggered for ODF
Number of households constructing and using their own toilet as result of UNICEF direct support
Number of additional people living in the newly certified Open Defecation Free (ODF) communities as a result of UNICEF CATS programming during the year of reporting
Number of schools supported by UNICEF during the year of reporting with separate sanitation facilities for boys and girls
Number of health centers equipped with sanitation and hygiene facilities with UNICEF direct support
Number of school children (boys, girls) with access to sanitation and hygiene facilities.
